org.mt4j.util.opengl
Class GLFBO

java.lang.Object
  org.mt4j.util.opengl.GLFBO

public class GLFBO
extends java.lang.Object

This class abstracts a opengl frame buffer object for easier usage. This can mainly be used to draw to an offscreen buffer and use that buffer as a texture later.

Author:
Christopher Ruff

Method Detail

addNewTexture

public GLTexture addNewTexture()
Attaches a gl texture object to the frame buffer object. The texture will contain everything drawn when the fbo is bound.

Returns:
the gL texture

addNewTexture

public GLTexture addNewTexture(boolean useMipMap)
This creates a GLTexture object with the FBO dimensions and attaches it to this frame buffer object. The texture can later be used to texture a component.

Returns:
the gL texture

add

public boolean add(GLTexture tex)

contains

public boolean contains(GLTexture arg0)

remove

public boolean remove(GLTexture arg0)

clear

public void clear(boolean clearColorBuffer,
                  float r,
                  float g,
                  float b,
                  float a,
                  boolean clearDepthBuffer)
If clearColorBuffer is set to true this clears the colorbuffer with the specified color values.
If clearDepthBuffer is set to true this clears the depth buffer of the framebuffer object.
NOTE: It seems that a texture has to be attached to the FBO first, for this to work as expected.
NOTE: This method will bind and unbind the FBO! So use this method only outside of startRenderToTexture() or bind()

Parameters:
clearColorBuffer - the color to clear the color buffer with
r - the r
g - the g
b - the b
a - the a
clearDepthBuffer - clear the depth buffer

bind

protected void bind()

startRenderToTexture

public void startRenderToTexture()
Sets up this frame buffer object to render all following rendering commands into the offscreen textures which are attached to the frame buffer object.

stopRenderToTexture

public void stopRenderToTexture()
Stops this FBO from rendering in to the attached texture(s).

NOTE: To use the texture we rendered into, it might me necessary to bind the texture and then call gl.glGenerateMipmapEXT(texture.getTextureTarget()); for mipmap generation. Else we might get a black texture! (not yet confirmed)

unBind

protected void unBind()
